result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon S Shay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $328.00 to Robert Haack Jewelry (Glendale).  Bail to apply, if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.

Pay all applicable costs and surcharges and supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept.
All Court costs, fees, surcharges and restitituion to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment with tax intercept or other means.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain employment or school.
Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.

Medically assisted treatment if appropriate.
Complete any and all other counseling deemed appropriate.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs or alcohol.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon S Shay

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon S Shay in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Defendant Brandon S Shay in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of TWENTY-FOUR (24) MONTHS, with credit for ONE HUNDRED NINETY (190) days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is TWELVE (12) MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is TWELVE (12) MONTHS.  The defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Medically assisted treatment if appropriate.
* Complete any and all other counselling deemed appropriate.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. 
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Obtain and maintain employment or school.
* Restitution payable to ROBERT HAACK JEWELRY (GLENDALE) for THREE HUNDRED TWENTY-EIGHT DOLLARS AND SIXTY CENTS ($328.60) or civil judgment WITH tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH Tax Intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges AND restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment WITH tax intercept or other means.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Brandon S Shay in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Defendant Brandon S Shay in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  STEPHANIE S. appeared on behalf of the Defendant.  sdg

The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Br. 33.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Brandon S Shay in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Brandon S Shay in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS. 

 The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Case transferred to br 6 for drug treatment court admissions on 6/24/2015 at 1:30pm.  lms
